Description: Rim, body and handle sherd (mended from eight fragments, with added plaster) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior streakily glazed save for band at top of lip; exterior: streaky black band on rim and upper part of shoulder, reserved below; glazed black on handle; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B1 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies this sherd as coming from a Type 11,3.A South Ionian cup with everted rim. Very few Type 11 cups were found at Naukratis and Schlotzhauer suggests that these may have been made in specific workshops that rarely exported vases to Naukratis. The place of production of Type 11 South Ionian cups is determined as Miletus based on the results of NAA analysis carried out by Hans Mommsen, Bonn, on another sherd (British Museum 1886,0401.570) from Naukratis and of same shape, decoration, and fabric. The number in Petrie's catalogue, 235, is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 235)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 662, no. 196)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 53, no. 374, NAU 55, pl.12d-e)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.252) (Phase 3)
